answers.author: Elizabeth Kellar
answers.text:
Yes, many local governments have made changes to retirement plans, most commonly increasing the contributions new and current employees make to their retirement.  See the link below for the 2013 workforce trends survey by the Center for State and Local Government Excellence.   Age and service requirements have been increased in some plans for new employees.
http://slge.org/publications/state-and-local-government-workforce-2013-trends

Hi, 
On the Knowledge Network we have many documents on understanding pension funding for local governments. Here are a few documents which you may find useful. 
Understanding Pension Funding is a recent article on pension calculations. http://icma.org/en/icma/newsroom/highlights/Article/103513/Understanding_Pension_Funding
State and Local Pensions: An overview of Funding Issues and Challenges is a recent document from the Center for State and Local Government Excellence. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/302480
I hope you find these articles useful and if you need more resources check out the documents section of the website (http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents)
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

title: Retirement Changes
